intro: Erigeron glabellus subsp. typicus, commonly known as the common fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows, prairies, and disturbed areas, and it thrives in full sun. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often hairy and branching. The flowers bloom in the summer, producing a showy display that attracts pollinators like bees and butterflies.
